page.title: 01THE MANACLES
page.content: The Manacles are a group of rocks off Manacle Point. They show up a lot at low tide but at high tide only a few tips can be seen. There is a warning bell buoy. Each rock has an individual name. Fishing is very good here but obviously dangerous. One of the worst wrecks was the {Mohegan} in 1898 when 106 people were drowned. 44 were rescued by the Porthoustock Life-boat. Another ship, the John, was wrecked on the outer Manacles and 190 died. The survivors were rescued by the Coverack Life-boat. The Manacles have claimed local lives too. Divers today use this area a lot for collecting memorabilia. There are many wrecks too numerous to mention.
